page.title: 15Recreation
page.content: The people of this area of the North York Moors are very good at creating their own entertainment and recreation. There is no public cinema, public house or club and dance hall. The only building for entertainment outside of the home is the village hall. The villagers hold most of their dances, whist drives and other recreational activities in this hall. For other recreational activities people travel to the neighbouring villages of Sleights, Ruswarp, Sneaton and to Whitby and Scrborough. The farmers main recreation is shooting and conservation, many of them belonging to a syndicate which puts down many birds each year and helps with the conservation and environment. Youngers people tend to be members of the Young Farmers Clubs.
